subject: RE: [junit] running out of memory
msgSnippet: ... I had an issue w/ JUnit running out of memory just before xmas. At first I was baffled as running the tests individually went fine but running a lot
messageBody:
> Let's assume that the problem here is this: JUnit 3, by
> requiring test
> cases to all be in memory before any running happens, could be used
> fairly memory effectively, but only if:
>
> 1) All large TestCase fields were only initialized in setUp
> 2) All large TestCase fields were set back to null in tearDown
>
> Otherwise, no test cases or fields could be garbage collected, and
> memory usage climbs steadily up as tests are executed.

I had an issue w/ JUnit running out of memory just before xmas. At
first I was baffled as running the tests individually went fine but
running a lot (hundreds) of tests caused JUnit to run out of memory (the
classes under test used jaxb to read a lot of xml). After digging I
found that I had misunderstood how JUnit works. I thought that after a
test is run, there is no more use for that test object so the reference
to it is discarded. This is not so, as I found reading the FAQ entry
"When are tests garbage collected?":

http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests_18

So, I made tearDown set reference to anything instantiated in setUp to
null and the problem was gone.




-Antti-
